title.value: Deep learning prediction of response to disease modifying therapy in primary progressive multiple sclerosis
title.justification: The title is clearly indicated in section GP.2 of the paper.
title.quote:
GP.2

Deep learning prediction of response to disease modifying therapy in primary progressive multiple sclerosis

extractions.description: This paper presents a deep learning approach to predict the response of individuals with primary progressive multiple sclerosis (PPMS) to disease modifying therapies (DMTs). An ensemble of multitask multilayer perceptrons was trained using clinical and MRI data to estimate conditional average treatment effects (CATE), allowing for the identification of individuals most likely to benefit from DMTs.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments with data from clinical trials and a deep learning model implementation to predict treatment effects.
type.quote: Methods: Baseline clinical and MRI data were acquired as part of three placebo-controlled randomized clinical trials... An ensemble of multitask multilayer perceptrons was trained...

name.justification: The study involves MRI data and deep learning models applied to predict responses to treatment in multiple sclerosis, which is a common application of Medical Imaging.
name.quote: Methods: Baseline clinical and MRI data were acquired as part of three placebo-controlled randomized clinical trials...

name.justification: Multiple sclerosis and its treatment fall under the domain of neuroscience.
name.quote:
GP.2

Deep learning prediction of response to disease modifying therapy in primary progressive multiple sclerosis

name.justification: The study utilizes deep learning techniques to make predictions about treatment outcomes.
name.quote: An ensemble of multitask multilayer perceptrons was trained to predict the rate of disability progression...

name.justification: The paper describes using an ensemble of multitask multilayer perceptrons for predicting treatment responses.
name.quote: An ensemble of multitask multilayer perceptrons was trained to predict the rate of disability progression...

is_compared.justification: The model's predictions were validated as having a larger effect size than the general group, indicating numerical comparison.
is_compared.quote: The top 25% of individuals predicted to respond most have a larger effect size...

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific reference to a paper that the model is based on.

name.justification: The paper uses clinical and MRI data from the ORATORIO clinical trial as part of their dataset.
name.quote: Data from ORATORIO and OLYMPUS was separated into a training (70%) and testing (30%) set.
